explanation: a set of leather straps that are put around a horse's head to allow its rider to control it
sentence: Saddles, bits and bridles are frequently ornamented with substantial amounts of silver.
sentence_gap: Saddles, bits and _______ are frequently ornamented with substantial amounts of silver.

explanation: a large, flat piece of stone or concrete used for paths, floors, etc
sentence: Today, with cheap and frequent shipping routes, timber has replaced flagstone as the most viable resource on the island.
sentence_gap: Today, with cheap and frequent shipping routes, timber has replaced _________ as the most viable resource on the island.

sentence: Some mushrooms look innocuous but are in fact poisonous.
sentence_gap: Some mushrooms look _________ but are in fact poisonous.

explanation: feeling or expressing great happiness, especially because of a success
sentence: The fans were in a jubilant mood after the victory.
sentence_gap: The fans were in a ________ mood after the victory.

explanation: not strict, severe, or careful enough about work, rules, or standards of behavior
sentence: The subcommittee contends that the authorities were lax in investigating most of the cases.
sentence_gap: The subcommittee contends that the authorities were ___ in investigating most of the cases.

explanation: formal; (of buildings, mountains, etc.) very high and impressive; (of a thought, an aim, etc.) deserving praise because of its high moral quality
sentence: Man's life here is incomplete, and the more lofty his aims, the more worthy his labors, the more incomplete will it appear to be.
sentence_gap: Man's life here is incomplete, and the more _____ his aims, the more worthy his labors, the more incomplete will it appear to be.

explanation: to touch, rub, or press something or someone gently and/or in a way that shows your love, especially with the head or nose, usually with small repeated movements
sentence: My dog came and nuzzled my foot to try and cheer me up.
sentence_gap: My dog came and _______ my foot to try and cheer me up.

explanation: a person who is trained to do medical work, especially in an emergency, but who is not a doctor or nurse
sentence: Paramedics treated the injured at the roadside.
sentence_gap: __________ treated the injured at the roadside.

explanation: used to describe something that sounds slightly sad
sentence: I love the plaintive sound of the bagpipes.
sentence_gap: I love the _________ sound of the bagpipes.

explanation: the hard outer layer or covering of particular fruits and foods
sentence: Add the grated rind of one lemon.
sentence_gap: Add the grated ____ of one lemon.

explanation: informal; the thick liquid that is produced in your nose
sentence: I resolved to start carrying more handkerchiefs, because after the Reverend, I was fresh out of snot rags.
sentence_gap: I resolved to start carrying more handkerchiefs, because after the Reverend, I was fresh out of ____ rags.

explanation: to cry noisily, taking in deep breaths
sentence: You're not going to help matters by lying there sobbing!
sentence_gap: You're not going to help matters by lying there _______!

explanation: literary; (especially of a color, light, or feeling) to spread all over or through someone or something
sentence: The room was suffused with a soft golden light.
sentence_gap: The room was ________ with a soft golden light.

explanation: to walk around slowly in a relaxed way or without any clear purpose or direction
sentence: We spent the morning wandering around the old part of the city.
sentence_gap: We spent the morning _________ around the old part of the city.

explanation: a delicate, thin, and sometimes twisting piece or line of something
sentence: A wisp of smoke from the campfire curled in the air.
sentence_gap: A ____ of smoke from the campfire curled in the air.
